sn4.8:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn4.8:4.3: The Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha
sn4.8:4.4: and recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn4.8:5.2: Your cattle also bring you delight!
sn4.8:5.3: For attachments are a man’s delight;
sn4.8:6.2: Your cattle also bring you sorrow.
sn4.8:6.3: For attachments are a man’s sorrow;
sn4.8:7.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
